verses.kjv: Then all Israel gathered themselves to David unto Hebron, saying, Behold, we are thy bone and thy flesh.
verses.web: Then all Israel gathered themselves to David to Hebron, saying, “Behold, we are your bone and your flesh.
verses.ct: All of Israel came together to meet David at Hebron. They told him, "We are your own flesh and blood."

verses.kjv: And moreover in time past, even when Saul was king, thou wast he that leddest out and broughtest in Israel: and the LORD thy God said unto thee, Thou shalt feed my people Israel, and thou shalt be ruler over my people Israel.
verses.web: In times past, even when Saul was king, it was you who led out and brought in Israel. LORD your God said to you, ‘You shall be shepherd of my people Israel, and you shall be prince over my people Israel.’ ”
verses.ct: "Even back when Saul was king, you were the one who actually led Israel's armies in and out of battle. And the LORD your God told you, 'You will shepherd my people Israel and be their ruler.'"

verses.kjv: Therefore came all the elders of Israel to the king to Hebron; and David made a covenant with them in Hebron before the LORD; and they anointed David king over Israel, according to the word of the LORD by Samuel.
verses.web: So all the elders of Israel came to the king to Hebron; and David made a covenant with them in Hebron before LORD; and they anointed David king over Israel, according to LORD’s word by Samuel.
verses.ct: So all the elders of Israel came to the king at Hebron, and David made a covenant with them there in the LORD's presence. They anointed David as king over Israel, just as the LORD had promised through Samuel.

verses.kjv: And David and all Israel went to Jerusalem, which is Jebus; where the Jebusites were, the inhabitants of the land.
verses.web: David and all Israel went to Jerusalem (also called Jebus); and the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land, were there.
verses.ct: David and all Israel then marched to Jerusalem — also known as Jebus — where the Jebusites still lived.

verses.kjv: And the inhabitants of Jebus said to David, Thou shalt not come hither. Nevertheless David took the castle of Zion, which is the city of David.
verses.web: The inhabitants of Jebus said to David, “You will not come in here.” Nevertheless David took the stronghold of Zion. The same is David’s city.
verses.ct: The people of Jebus taunted David, saying, "You'll never get in here!" But David captured the fortress of Zion, which became known as the city of David.

verses.kjv: And David said, Whosoever smiteth the Jebusites first shall be chief and captain. So Joab the son of Zeruiah went first up, and was chief.
verses.web: David said, “Whoever strikes the Jebusites first shall be chief and captain.” Joab the son of Zeruiah went up first, and was made chief.
verses.ct: David announced, "Whoever leads the attack against the Jebusites will become my chief commander." Joab son of Zeruiah was the first to charge in, so he was made chief.

verses.kjv: And David dwelt in the castle; therefore they called it the city of David.
verses.web: David lived in the stronghold; therefore they called it David’s city.
verses.ct: David made the fortress his home, and that's why it was called the city of David.

verses.kjv: And he built the city round about, even from Millo round about: and Joab repaired the rest of the city.
verses.web: He built the city all around, from Millo even around; and Joab repaired the rest of the city.
verses.ct: He expanded the city all around it, starting from the Millo and working outward, while Joab restored the rest of the city.

verses.kjv: So David waxed greater and greater: for the LORD of hosts was with him.
verses.web: David grew greater and greater; for LORD of Armies was with him.
verses.ct: David grew more and more powerful, because the LORD of hosts was with him.

verses.kjv: These also are the chief of the mighty men whom David had, who strengthened themselves with him in his kingdom, and with all Israel, to make him king, according to the word of the LORD concerning Israel.
verses.web: Now these are the chief of the mighty men whom David had, who showed themselves strong with him in his kingdom, together with all Israel, to make him king, according to LORD’s word concerning Israel.
verses.ct: These are the leaders of David's mighty warriors — men who fought alongside him and all Israel to establish his kingdom, just as the LORD had spoken concerning Israel.

verses.kjv: And this is the number of the mighty men whom David had; Jashobeam, an Hachmonite, the chief of the captains: he lifted up his spear against three hundred slain by him at one time.
verses.web: This is the number of the mighty men whom David had: Jashobeam, the son of a Hachmonite, the chief of the thirty; he lifted up his spear against three hundred and killed them at one time.
verses.ct: Here is the roster of David's mighty warriors: Jashobeam, a Hachmonite, was the chief of the captains. He once raised his spear against 300 men and killed them all in a single battle.

verses.kjv: And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodo, the Ahohite, who was one of the three mighties.
verses.web: After him was Eleazar the son of Dodo, the Ahohite, who was one of the three mighty men.
verses.ct: Next was Eleazar son of Dodo the Ahohite, one of the 3 greatest warriors.

verses.kjv: He was with David at Pasdammim, and there the Philistines were gathered together to battle, where was a parcel of ground full of barley; and the people fled from before the Philistines.
verses.web: He was with David at Pasdammim, and there the Philistines were gathered together to battle, where there was a plot of ground full of barley; and the people fled from before the Philistines.
verses.ct: He was with David at Pasdammim when the Philistines gathered there for battle. There was a field full of barley, and the Israelite troops fled from the Philistines.

verses.kjv: And they set themselves in the midst of that parcel, and delivered it, and slew the Philistines; and the LORD saved them by a great deliverance.
verses.web: They stood in the middle of the plot, defended it, and killed the Philistines; and LORD saved them by a great victory.
verses.ct: But Eleazar and David took their stand in the middle of that field, defended it, and struck down the Philistines. The LORD gave them a great victory.

verses.kjv: Now three of the thirty captains went down to the rock to David, into the cave of Adullam; and the host of the Philistines encamped in the valley of Rephaim.
verses.web: Three of the thirty chief men went down to the rock to David, into the cave of Adullam; and the army of the Philistines were encamped in the valley of Rephaim.
verses.ct: On another occasion, 3 of the 30 leading warriors went down to the rock where David was staying, at the cave of Adullam, while the Philistine army was camped in the valley of Rephaim.

verses.kjv: And David was then in the hold, and the Philistines’ garrison was then at Bethlehem.
verses.web: David was then in the stronghold, and the garrison of the Philistines was in Bethlehem at that time.
verses.ct: David was in his stronghold at the time, and a Philistine garrison occupied Bethlehem.

verses.kjv: And David longed, and said, Oh that one would give me drink of the water of the well of Bethlehem, that is at the gate!
verses.web: David longed, and said, “Oh that one would give me water to drink from the well of Bethlehem, which is by the gate!”
verses.ct: David was overcome with longing and said, "If only someone would bring me a drink of water from the well by the gate of Bethlehem!"

verses.kjv: And the three brake through the host of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Bethlehem, that was by the gate, and took it, and brought it to David: but David would not drink of it, but poured it out to the LORD,
verses.web: The three broke through the army of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Bethlehem, that was by the gate, and took it, and brought it to David; but David would not drink any of it, but poured it out to LORD,
verses.ct: So the 3 warriors broke through the Philistine lines, drew water from the well by the gate of Bethlehem, and carried it back to David. But David refused to drink it. Instead, he poured it out as an offering to the LORD,

verses.kjv: And said, My God forbid it me, that I should do this thing: shall I drink the blood of these men that have put their lives in jeopardy? for with the jeopardy of their lives they brought it. Therefore he would not drink it. These things did these three mightiest.
verses.web: and said, “My God forbid me, that I should do this! Shall I drink the blood of these men who have put their lives in jeopardy?” For they risked their lives to bring it. Therefore he would not drink it. The three mighty men did these things.
verses.ct: saying, "My God forbid that I should drink this! Should I drink the blood of these men who risked their lives to bring it?" Because they had put their lives on the line to get it, he wouldn't drink it. These were the kinds of things the 3 mightiest warriors did.

verses.kjv: And Abishai the brother of Joab, he was chief of the three: for lifting up his spear against three hundred, he slew them, and had a name among the three.
verses.web: Abishai, the brother of Joab, he was chief of the three; for he lifted up his spear against three hundred and killed them, and had a name among the three.
verses.ct: Abishai, Joab's brother, was the leader of another group of 3. He once raised his spear against 300 men and killed them, earning a reputation among the 3.

verses.kjv: Of the three, he was more honourable than the two; for he was their captain: howbeit he attained not to the first three.
verses.web: Of the three, he was more honorable than the two, and was made their captain; however he wasn’t included in the three.
verses.ct: He was the most honored of the 3 and became their captain, but he didn't rank among the top 3 warriors.

verses.kjv: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done many acts; he slew two lionlike men of Moab: also he went down and slew a lion in a pit in a snowy day.
verses.web: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done mighty deeds, killed the two sons of Ariel of Moab. He also went down and killed a lion in the middle of a pit on a snowy day.
verses.ct: Benaiah son of Jehoiada was a brave warrior from Kabzeel who performed many heroic deeds. He struck down 2 of Moab's fiercest champions. He also went down into a pit on a snowy day and killed a lion.

verses.kjv: And he slew an Egyptian, a man of great stature, five cubits high; and in the Egyptian’s hand was a spear like a weaver’s beam; and he went down to him with a staff, and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand, and slew him with his own spear.
verses.web: He killed an Egyptian, a man of great stature, five cubits high. In the Egyptian’s hand was a spear like a weaver’s beam; and he went down to him with a staff, plucked the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand, and killed him with his own spear.
verses.ct: He also killed an Egyptian who was a giant of a man — 5 cubits tall. The Egyptian carried a spear as thick as a weaver's beam, but Benaiah went at him with just a staff, snatched the spear from the Egyptian's hand, and killed him with his own weapon.

verses.kjv: These things did Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and had the name among the three mighties.
verses.web: Benaiah the son of Jehoiada did these things, and had a name among the three mighty men.
verses.ct: These were the exploits of Benaiah son of Jehoiada, and they earned him a reputation among the 3 mightiest warriors.

verses.kjv: Behold, he was honourable among the thirty, but attained not to the first three: and David set him over his guard.
verses.web: Behold, he was more honorable than the thirty, but he didn’t attain to the three; and David set him over his guard.
verses.ct: He was more honored than any of the 30, though he didn't rank among the top 3. David put him in charge of his personal bodyguard.

verses.kjv: Also the valiant men of the armies were, Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem,
verses.web: The mighty men of the armies also include Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan the son of Dodo of Bethlehem,
verses.ct: The mighty warriors of the army also included: Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan son of Dodo from Bethlehem,

verses.kjv: Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,
verses.web: Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,
verses.ct: Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,

verses.kjv: Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Antothite,
verses.web: Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Anathothite,
verses.ct: Ira son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Antothite,

verses.kjv: Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,
verses.web: Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,
verses.ct: Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,

verses.kjv: Maharai the Netophathite, Heled the son of Baanah the Netophathite,
verses.web: Maharai the Netophathite, Heled the son of Baanah the Netophathite,
verses.ct: Maharai the Netophathite, Heled son of Baanah the Netophathite,

verses.kjv: Ithai the son of Ribai of Gibeah, that pertained to the children of Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite,
verses.web: Ithai the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the children of Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite,
verses.ct: Ithai son of Ribai from Gibeah of Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite,

verses.kjv: Hurai of the brooks of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,
verses.web: Hurai of the brooks of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,
verses.ct: Hurai from the ravines of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,

verses.kjv: Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,
verses.web: Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,
verses.ct: Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,

verses.kjv: The sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan the son of Shage the Hararite,
verses.web: the sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan the son of Shagee the Hararite,
verses.ct: the sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan son of Shage the Hararite,

verses.kjv: Ahiam the son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal the son of Ur,
verses.web: Ahiam the son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal the son of Ur,
verses.ct: Ahiam son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal son of Ur,

verses.kjv: Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,
verses.web: Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,
verses.ct: Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,

verses.kjv: Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai the son of Ezbai,
verses.web: Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai the son of Ezbai,
verses.ct: Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai son of Ezbai,

verses.kjv: Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar the son of Haggeri,
verses.web: Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar the son of Hagri,
verses.ct: Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar son of Haggeri,

verses.kjv: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite, the armourbearer of Joab the son of Zeruiah,
verses.web: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite, the armor bearer of Joab the son of Zeruiah,
verses.ct: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite — the armor bearer of Joab son of Zeruiah —

verses.kjv: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
verses.web: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,
verses.ct: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,

verses.kjv: Uriah the Hittite, Zabad the son of Ahlai,
verses.web: Uriah the Hittite, Zabad the son of Ahlai,
verses.ct: Uriah the Hittite, Zabad son of Ahlai,

verses.kjv: Adina the son of Shiza the Reubenite, a captain of the Reubenites, and thirty with him,
verses.web: Adina the son of Shiza the Reubenite, a chief of the Reubenites, and thirty with him,
verses.ct: Adina son of Shiza the Reubenite — a captain among the Reubenites — along with 30 men under him,

verses.kjv: Hanan the son of Maachah, and Joshaphat the Mithnite,
verses.web: Hanan the son of Maacah, and Joshaphat the Mithnite,
verses.ct: Hanan son of Maachah, Joshaphat the Mithnite,

verses.kjv: Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jehiel the sons of Hothan the Aroerite,
verses.web: Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jeiel the sons of Hotham the Aroerite,
verses.ct: Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jehiel the sons of Hothan the Aroerite,

verses.kjv: Jediael the son of Shimri, and Joha his brother, the Tizite,
verses.web: Jediael the son of Shimri, and Joha his brother, the Tizite,
verses.ct: Jediael son of Shimri, and his brother Joha the Tizite,

verses.kjv: Eliel the Mahavite, and Jeribai, and Joshaviah, the sons of Elnaam, and Ithmah the Moabite,
verses.web: Eliel the Mahavite, and Jeribai, and Joshaviah, the sons of Elnaam, and Ithmah the Moabite,
verses.ct: Eliel the Mahavite, Jeribai and Joshaviah the sons of Elnaam, Ithmah the Moabite,

verses.kjv: Eliel, and Obed, and Jasiel the Mesobaite.
verses.web: Eliel, and Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.
verses.ct: Eliel, Obed, and Jasiel the Mesobaite.
